ygData.subject: Re: Song Analysis Statistics?
ygData.msgSnippet: ... All DoTs work like that. ... I would also suggest you report how many rounds you time and average over.  I usually try for at least 10 rounds.  e.g. I
ygData.messageBody:
On Tue, 16 Nov 1999, Rokenn Swiftsong wrote:
>
> The main problem with the majority of our damage songs is they do not give
> feedback on how much damage they do. A wizard casts her Ice Comet spell and
> sees: 'A Gnoll Pup says, hit by 1100 damage non-melee'
> or something like that, we launch or instrument barage of death and see:
> A gnoll pup winces
> A gnoll pup winces
> Your wounds begin to heal

All DoTs work like that.

> 5) If testing attack speed up/slowdown effects be sure you have a clean
> connection with little or no lag.

I would also suggest you report how many "rounds" you time and
average over. I usually try for at least 10 rounds. e.g. I
play Celerity, and time how long it takes to swing 10 times.
The only gotcha is that if you're counting each swing and
stopping the stopwatch when you say "10," then you have to
start counting at 0, not 1.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
